title: The Fatal Phone Call
description: Chet gets himself into a jam when he answers a pay phone and then tries to locate a guy who doesn't want to be found.

title: Lullaby and Goodnight
description: Chet tries a number of remedies, including a set of earplugs that painfully don't work, to deal with a neighbor's barking dog that's continually robbing him of sleep.

title: The Best Hook Shot in the World
A Girl Named Punkin
description: An autistic eight-year-old girl nicknamed Punkin unexpectedly shows up on Chet's front doorstep.

title: Rules Is Rules
description: Chet gets more than he bargained for when he makes a bet with Marsha that he can get a purchase order for a new piece of equipment by the end of the day.

title: Let X Equal a Lousy Weekend
description: When Chet is forced to fill in as a substitute algebra teacher, he comes across a word problem that he is unable to solve for the class. So, he spends most of his weekend trying to find the solution.

title: The Killer Instinct
description: As an assistant football coach, Chet finds himself in a tough situation when he is "asked" by a suspected mobster to make sure that his hardly athletic son makes the team.

title: Brotherly Love
description: Chet's brother and his sister-in-law are having some marital difficulties, leading his brother to move in with Chet -- straining his relationship with Chet, too.

title: Going the Route
description: Chet reluctantly agrees to deliver the morning papers for his nephew who is sick in bed.

title: A Word from Our Sponsor
description: A chance encounter on the street leads Chet to try out, and eventually to get hired, for a job playing an athletic coach in a breakfast cereal television commercial. Chet discovers, however, that shooting 30 seconds of film isn't as simple as it appears when the final product is seen on television.

title: A Christmas Ballad
description: Needing someone to play Santa Claus for the community center, Chet bribes a surly old man who was recently fired from his job selling Christmas trees.

title: Growing, Growing, Grown
description: Unfortunate circumstances lead to Chet having to drive his date to the dance in his brother's garbage truck.

title: The Elevator Doesn't Stop Here Anymore
description: Chet must figure out ways to kill time when he is trapped overnight in an elevator with a fellow teacher and a cleaning lady.

title: Lover's Quarrel
description: Chet intervenes in the relationship between his perpetually bickering aunt and uncle. Meanwhile, at school, he copes with a student who refuses to participate in gym class.

title: The Worst Crook That Ever Lived
The Gumball Incident
description: A gum-ball machine is knocked over by a kid who runs off before Chet can catch up to him. The store owner, seeing that Chet is the only person in the vicinity, takes him to court.

title: Goodbye, Cruel World
description: Chet convinces a shy cafeteria worker to get up the nerve and ask a waitress out on a date. When he is turned down, Chet must find a way to talk him out of committing suicide.

title: Driven to Distraction
description: Chets gets more than he bargained for when he agrees to teach a driver's ed course and encounters a self-deprecating student who is a danger on the road.

title: Blind Date
description: Chet complains bitterly when his sister-in-law Verna sets him up on a blind date with Mildred, an employee of an airline who is in town for a few days. He discovers, however, that she's an attractive, intelligent woman who shares many of his interests -- so that confirmed bachelor Chet is surprised to find himself falling in love.

title: How You Play the Game
description: After he encounters a competitive player who exhibits a disregard for sportsmanship, Chet tries to teach him a lesson by inviting him to his handball game and observe proper sportsmanship.

title: The Return of Big Bad Bubba Bronson
description: Chet gets word that a former classmate, "Big Bad Bubba" Bronson, whom Chet recalls has a grudge against him, is coming to town to even the score. Chet's solution is to seek boxing lessons for self-defense -- by hiring a down-on-his-luck boxer named Hurricane Smith. But the solution soon seems worse than the cure when Smith not only talks Chet into paying him for his time, but also moves in with him.

title: This Mouth Is Rated X
description: Chet is unsure how to handle one of his basketball players who is constantly letting profanities slip out of his mouth.

title: Really Cool
description: Chet is approached by a student who is profiling Holmes High School's teachers for the school newspaper, and wants to make Chet the subject of his next article. Chet writes up a summary of his past exploits as an athlete, but begins to embellish it as he and the student review Chet's recollections, so that he soon portrays himself as a star at baseball, football, basketball, boxing, and track.

title: Any Time You're Ready, CK
description: Holmes High's football team is having trouble on the field, and the players suggest that Chet film their scrimmages to help them correct their mistakes. At first he resists the suggestion, but then borrows a camera and its equipment and begins experimenting with it. In the meantime, a former star football player named Alex returns after a career-ending leg injury. Chet is distressed that Alex plans to drop out of school because his football-playing days are over, and suggests that Alex become his assistant coach instead.

title: Open House
description: Chet tries his luck at selling Real Estate, with memorable results.

title: Is There a Doctor in the Hospital?
description: Chet hurts his back while showing his class how to use the parallel bars. A fellow gym teacher helps him get to the hospital, but Chet discovers that that's only the beginning of his problems, as he deals first with health insurance issues, and then has encounters with just about everyone at the hospital - except a doctor who knows how to treat an injured back.

title: There Must Be a Party
description: Chet tells the story of his surprising surprise birthday party.

title: The Old Man of 4-C
description: Chet's life is turned upside down by a pesky neighbor, who is an insufferable bore.

title: The Lincoln Letter
description: Chet inherits his great-aunt's estate including a prized letter from Abraham Lincoln, and it brings him lots of unwanted attention and headaches.

title: The Runaways
description: Young Raymond decides to become an easy rider by running away from home to San Francisco, so Chet gives him a ride.

title: The Deluge: Part 1
description: A severe storm with flooding has Chet stranded at home without telephone or electrical service. To make matters worse, a neighbor has just gone into labor, and Chet is in a quandary as to what to do.

title: The Deluge: Part 2
description: Dolores enters advanced stages of labor, and Chet enters advanced stages of unease.

title: Swann's Way
description: A repossessor is intent on snatching Chet's TV set.

title: Teacher of the Year
description: Chet learns that being honored as Teacher Of The Year isn't all that's it's cracked up to be.

title: To Each According to His Appetite
Viva Ortega
description: In exchange for a custom-built stereo cabinet, Chet agrees to teach American history and civics to a Mexican carpenter hoping to become an American citizen.

title: The Miraculous Martin
description: For a children's party, Chet hires a magician named "The Miraculous Martin". Too bad Martin is also a drunkard.

title: The Sesame Street Rumble
description: Chet has a super-duper TV antenna installed, so he can pick up the big game, which has been locally blacked out. With a houseful of eager teachers, Chet's TV set breaks down right before opening kickoff, so he must quickly hunt down another set.

title: The Generation Gap
description: Chet's father stays with him, while his mother is out-of-town.

title: Tobacco Road
description: A friend leans heavily on Chet to help him quit smoking cigarettes.

title: The Green-Eyed Monster
description: Jealousy rears its ugly head when Chet's girlfriend carries on a business association with an old boyfriend, who is now a rich doctor.

title: The Saturday Game
description: A boy, who practices Hasidic Judaism, joins the baseball team coached by Chet. The boy faces a dilemma, when the next weekly game's date switches from Sunday to Saturday, which falls on the Jewish Sabbath.
